subject: Knowing test-state in tearDown()?
msgSnippet: Hi. I would like to dump the state of the system when at test fails. So I need to know when a test fails before cleaning up the system. E.g. (java): protected
messageBody:
Hi.

I would like to dump the state of the system when at test fails.

So I need to know when a test fails before cleaning up the system.

E.g. (java):
protected void tearDown() throws Exception {
if (testFailed()) {
dumpStateForDebugging();
}
super.tearDown();
}


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
